str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up. From ana and the base of basis; to go up.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Formerly, before. Neuter of proteros as adverb; previously.
